website_summaries.verdict: Whether you're tackling Thanksgiving dinner or slicing foam for a craft project, this is a powerful and easy-to-master electric knife.
pros: Excellent for evenly slicing bread and meat
cons: It would be nice if the blades were just a little longer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts foam really well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut upholstery foam - it did the job well (I was cutting 6" foam) although it did get a little heated as we went - in all fairness that foam is a little tougher than a Thanksgiving turkey, but it's good to know if you're turkey is a tough old bird this will slice it nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Why doesn’t everyone have one of these in their kitchen?
customer_reviews.text: I’m surprised how often I’ve used this. I originally purchased it for a project involving the cutting of foam material. The project was put on the back burner for a year. Thanksgiving rolled around and I tried it on my turkey. I was surprised how effortless it was to have beautiful deli slices. i later started using the knife to slice salamis, and pepperonis. In a drunken stroke of brilliance, I discovered how useful it was for slicing a beautiful cooked steak (after letting the meat rest, of course). Restaurant quality slices of a medium-cooked steak is an effortless crowd pleaser. Why doesn’t everyone have one of these in their kitchen?
customer_reviews.author: K Cheese

customer_reviews.title: Purchased to cut foam
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to cut pieces of foam for a new seat cushion. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: sheena6green

customer_reviews.title: it does get pretty hot using it for more than the length of ...
customer_reviews.text: While this electric turkey carving knife works perfectly, it does get pretty hot using it for more than the length of time it would take to carve a turkey. I used it to cut a foam mattress and it worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Christine L.

customer_reviews.title: So flimsy I thew it in the trash after the first use
customer_reviews.text: The old adage, you get what you pay for, really applies here to this super inexpensive and cheaply made bread slicing guide. First off - the plastic guides are so weak that it is impossible to rely on them to cut a straight slice of any uniform thickness. When I tried to hold the guide down while cutting, the handle part twisted and provided little-to-no support. Next, the design does not allow for the use of an electric knife though the guides are so flimsy you could probably force one in between anyway. The bottom line is save your money and look for something built with quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't know about bread, but it's great on foam.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price point for a very useful item. I use this knife for cutting the foam in cases like Pelican, Nanuk, and Ape to hold photo equipment. Works beautifully. If needed I will definitely come back for another.
customer_reviews.author: R. Noon

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: knife stalls half way thru cutting a turkey breast , knives will not release to clean them , spend a little more money and buy something better you will be glad you did , i wish i had
customer_reviews.author: glenn collins

customer_reviews.title: NIGHTMARE!
customer_reviews.text: I have used many electric knives over the past 30 years and this one is a NIGHTMARE......the handle design is horrible and hard to hang on to. And you have to apply a lot of pressure to the button to even get it to cut!!!!!! I thought with Proctor Silex I was safe as they are well-known brand but this thing is going in the trash!!!!!!! $14.99 down the tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Old fashioned knife is better
customer_reviews.text: I tried slicing a roasted leg of lamb today, first time with this. Disappointing. Just makes kinda shreddy, ragged slices. I'll be better off with a sharp knife. I've never had an electric knife so this is probably as good as it gets. I'm just not happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Melian

customer_reviews.title: Defective product. Unsafe to use.
customer_reviews.text: Defective product and unsafe to use. I bought this knife to cut foam. Everything looked fine when I opened the box, but as soon as I started using it I heard a weird noise coming from the handle. I looked into the handle where the blades insert and could see a ton of sparks. If I had it on for any more than five seconds I could feel heat building up and smoke would start seeping out of the handle. This is all without any prior use at all. I’m sure if I actually tried to use it I would be burned or electrocuted.
customer_reviews.author: k808soljah

customer_reviews.title: A spoon would cut more easily.
customer_reviews.text: I hate, hate, hate this knife. I just used it for the first time on a ham and put it right in the trashcan. I bought it because it was the same brand as my 30 year old electric knife that died. It did not cut easily. I had to use Herculean muscle to cut. The on button which you have to pull has a small bump to pull on and with greasy hands is impossible to hold. The knife also smells. I imagine the smell is because it was working so hard at not cutting. Trash. Zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: BN

customer_reviews.title: wasted money
customer_reviews.text: It is not to recommend.Very weak while cutting the deeper you cut the weaker it gets. Runs pretty slowly. To engage the knife you have to hold the switch underneath the knife body which is completely contrary to the way you cut
customer_reviews.author: roman

customer_reviews.title: A stick of butter is sharper
customer_reviews.text: I was dumbfounded by how underpowered this knife is- it pulls down cutting regular _bread_. Furthermore, the blade is so short you have to be right up against the bread so it will cut it- very uncomfortable. Blades dull- not sharp at all, requires force to get it through regular bread. I had an old Black & Decker- wish I'd kept it. Several weeks later, I finally threw this in the trash and am looking at different brands. So dull I couldn't even cut a fresh loaf of bread with it-- a regular knife is sharper and faster.... I hate this thing. So dull, I swear a stick of butter is sharper- and this is only after about 8 uses!
customer_reviews.author: FasterThanLight

customer_reviews.title: I want to think that 10 minutes would have been enough time to cool down, so this is concerning to me
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it in soon after receiving it as I had a project waiting that required me cutting a 4-inch thick piece of foam. ONE cut, unplugged the knife, came back about 10 minutes later to clean up my work area and the body of the knife was medium-HOT to touch. Hot, not warm. HOT. I want to think that 10 minutes would have been enough time to cool down, so this is concerning to me. It's a good thing I won't have much use for this knife too often, but I'm pretty concerned about the knife overheating AT ANY TIME during use.
customer_reviews.author: MendAngel

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed and Couldn't be Happier with this Electric Knife
customer_reviews.text: Wow this knife worked great! It was my first time for my wife and I hosting Thanksgiving and this carved the turkey and the ham like a hot knife through butter. Very sturdy knife nothing felt flimsy or took much effort to work or cut. My father-in-law who was a butcher most of his working career was even impressed with how well it cut. Couldn't be happier with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Deaver Jr

customer_reviews.title: Worthless- doesn't cut bread at all
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how this knife got any sort of positive rating. It's absolute crap. Tried to use it to cut through a loaf of artisan bread, and it was terrible. It didn't work at all. Wish I could return it but my family dumped the box. I think I'll just throw it in the trash. Anyone that wants it, let me know and you can have it for the shipping cost.
customer_reviews.author: AltEllie

customer_reviews.title: Not ergonomic to use and knife gets very hot!
customer_reviews.text: This knife gets very hot while trying to slice a loaf of bread. The power switch has to be constantly depressed and the power fluctuates during the slice. I do woodworking and I have much experience cutting and sawing and I can't cut a decent slice of bread with this thing to save myself! It's horrible. I'm online looking for a great knife to replace this really bad knife after trying to cut 2 loaves of fresh bread with hands that now ache from the poor design. It would be nice if the power button could stay on once depressed. Buy something else if you have more than a slice to cut!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: It works fine when you know what you're  doing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife based on a YouTube video of a guy cutting the foam in his rifle case. At first, I didn't understand exactly how it should work. I tried only one of the two blades at a time and was basically ready to put it back in the box and return it. Then I thought what the h, I'll try both blades together as if that will make a pick of difference; then it cut like a knife through warm butter. I could use some practice of course, but my failure is not the knifes fault. It works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Turner

customer_reviews.title: Awkward switch updated review.
customer_reviews.text: The trigger is very awkward to use. The knife feels sturdy, but the knives are about an inch and a half shorter than my old knife. Maybe after some use I will get used to using the switch idk. Update. After some use I absolutely hate this knife. The trigger is still very awkward. The knife gets really really hot after little use. It also gets super slippery with very little moisture on it. I don't know why the review I saw on this knife rated it so high! It also hurts my hands after very little use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Meier

customer_reviews.title: Works Pretty Well
customer_reviews.text: I got this to cut gun case foam and it actually worked much better than I was expecting. It's quiet and smooth cutting but you need to have a pre cut hole already made as the tip of the blades are blunt. Making sharp turns around angles was easy too and I was able to cut out multiple pieces quickly for my rifle case. My only complaint with it would be that the handle does heat up fast with continous use but I guess it isnt really made for what I'm using it for. Overall, very satisfied with the prpduct especially for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the money , use for slicing meats .
customer_reviews.text: Kind of awkward yomise , but goes a moderate job of cutting . I think it works okay but have only carved a ham so far and worked well . I have small hands Andi find this knife awkward to use. You don't push on it to slice but let it do its job with moderate pressure . Easy to assemble and clean . Okay product for the money. If you need a knife like this for bigger jobs buy one with more cutting power. This is fine for carving meat and I would say would work for pineapple .
customer_reviews.author: Linda D.

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't work very well
customer_reviews.text: I have cut into many a turkeys, roasts, and other slabs of meat. We thought this knife would speed things up and make things easier. It doesn't. The several times I have used it, I switch back to a regular knife. I think maybe the blade is not sharp enough? It really has a hard time slicing. I have applied more pressure and it makes the struggle even worse. We like our meats on the medium side of things. Perhaps if it was well done it would slice better? But, for our tender medium and medium-rare meats, it does not do well at all.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Haldeman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: The blades are short and dull. If your goal is to use this knife to cut Jello then this is the knife for you. If you want to use it to cut homemade bread then I suggest you buy another brand. Not to mention the motor gets hot and the trigger switch doesn’t always engage.
customer_reviews.author: everyday joe

customer_reviews.title: Produced Acrid Smell and Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: My first use of this knife was for cutting two very large beef briskets for Christmas dinner. While in use it started producing an acrid melting plastic smell that seemed to emanate from the front of the knife where the blades are inserted. A couple of days later we got it out to cut some more brisket and it no longer produced the smell, however, the blades no longer reciprocated. The motor would run, but the blades did not move. I'm returning it for a refund. For the short time that it worked it was a great knife, though.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great bread slicer
customer_reviews.text: My wife got a bread maker as a gift from her mother. She has a holder for slicing bread. This electric knife works perfectly for this application. Although the whole unit feels a little chincy it works well for what we use it for. The price is right. I would recommend it for slicing bread. Sometimes I chase my wife around the house with it. Then I cut her arm off and beat her with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It was not good
customer_reviews.text: This Proctor Silex electric knife was a huge disappointment. The design is bad for me. The handle is to big for my hand. The switch underneath is too small to get a grip on when you are carving a slippery turkey. Everyone else complained about the lenght of the blades but these other problems are way worse.
customer_reviews.author: Marti Pie

customer_reviews.title: Used it for foam padding!
customer_reviews.text: Great Turkey carver, heats up after extended use but never gave out. I used it to cut pads out of foam for drag hips and they did the job quick and easy! I highly recommend this product if it can cut 5 inch foam padding for 3 hours straight it could cut your turkey.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Perez

customer_reviews.title: Work's Great.
customer_reviews.text: I had this exact same electric knife and it just broke after having and using it for almost 19 years. I was very surprised to see that they still make this model. It works great, even if it only lasts for a year it's still worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Hanora1127

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value!
customer_reviews.text: This knife made carving our Thanksgiving turkey an absolute breeze. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is that it is quite difficult to hold on to once the juices start flowing. I found that wrapping a damp washrag around the handle helped with grip - and I only cut myself once with it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this knife four months ago. It stopped working altogether recently. It was an Amazon's Choice product and I am very disappointed that it is beyond the return date. The start button is hard to push down and you must exert a lot of pressure to get the blades to cut through even bread. Its quite a balancing act to hold the product you are cutting in one hand and press the starter button with the other hand while maintaining enough pressure to even get the knife to cut through even soft bread. I just threw this knife away feel sorry for anyone who buys it, especially anyone who has any strength issues.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to hold but would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought before Thanksgiving to cut my 21lb turkey and did exactly what I needed. The handle was a little awkward to hold after a coupe of slices because it was so big however seeing as I won't be using it every day, for a couple of uses a year it will do the job. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Ouch

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: The switch to turn the knife on is stiff and uncomfortable to use making it difficult to cut whatever you are trying to carve. An electric knife should make carving whatever easier and this product does not accomplish that basic goal.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Average

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My old knife finally died so this is the replacement. The knife is sharp and works very well. My only complaint is that the knife blades are 2 inches shorter than my old knife, and in my opinion the blades are a little too short. It is harder to slice up a large London Broil steak. Other than that I love the knife
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Great electric knife for the price. We just used it on 2 hams and a large Turkey! I told my daughter if it breaks after this it will be worth it. Everyone should have one of these because we zipped right through those hams and Turkey with ease. The control switch could have been a little better designed but that's all I can complain about. Buying a few for gifts this year
customer_reviews.author: cindyhugh123

customer_reviews.title: Can't cut the mustard!
customer_reviews.text: This product could not slice pork loin...it is not worth the money spent, and I do not recommend it at all! I previously owned a Proctor Silex Electric Knife for many years, and ordered this as a replacement. This product is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Brushwood

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, good value
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, good value, but I must say that I used this "off-label" to carve rigid foam for landscape on my train table, lubing with WD40 to prevent buildup of plastic on the blades. For this it has worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Cuts 3" foam like butter
customer_reviews.text: I banged off several 3" seat cushions for my porch with this lovely knife cutter. My lines were perfectly straight and I could not be happier with the outcome. Saved myself over $150.00, making them myself, plus they are a custom fit. Very comfy seating now.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Used it to cut foam out from my motorcycle seat
customer_reviews.text: Used it to cut foam out from my motorcycle seat and then put gel insert in. re-stapled leather back, Good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Completely dead.
customer_reviews.text: Completely dead straight out of the box. On Thanksgiving Day. With a house full of people ready to eat some turkey. Not like I couldn't use a regular knife, because that's what I did. But still...
customer_reviews.author: Mall Cop

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great, knife handle a little hard to hold.
customer_reviews.text: This knife cuts very well although I had some issues holding it. The knife handle is very large and a bit difficult for me to grasp. My family recently made ham and turkey and it cut right through with no problems. I would recommend this knife if you have bigger hands or don’t mind holding a larger sized handle!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laird Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, sharp, slices bread evenly
customer_reviews.text: I had my last electric knife (Hamilton Beach) for almost 30 years but finally had to replace it. I chose this Proctor Silex knife for it's good reviews, it's longer blade, and the company's general reputation. I'm not disappointed. The knife is sturdy, the blades sit firmly in the handle, it's easy and comfortable to reach the ON button, easy to release the blades. The blades are serrated, which works well for me, as I use the knife mostly for slicing homemade bread. After using it 5-6 times, I'm very pleased with this knife and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JoanOH

customer_reviews.title: Not cordless
customer_reviews.text: Be aware this is a corded knife. I wanted a cordless knife and none of the images showed a cord but when I got it I found it was corded.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Choice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this right after Christmas and it has been in the box since then. Just used it for the first time today. It made one slice through the prime rib and stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Well, I dont carve turkeys with this, I own an upholstery shop and use it to cut foam. Haha. They work great and when they break I buy another !
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE
customer_reviews.text: WORKS ACTUALLY...BETTER THAN SOME OF THE MORE EXPENSIVE ONES...IT DID EXACTLY WHAT I EXPECTED
customer_reviews.author: DELRAYSTU

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and Clean
customer_reviews.text: We bought it to cut our christmas turkey. I haven't owned or used any other electric knife so keep that in mind when reading my review. I do know that it was easy to put the blades on. We liked the safety feature. The knife will not cut unless the button is being held down. It was very easy to use, worked as intended, and the blades were easy to clean. We most likely will not be using it again until next Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: E.M.

customer_reviews.title: VERY SHORT BLADE
customer_reviews.text: I had a PS electric knife for 15 years until it finally gave out. I've never needed to spend a lot of money on something - I just need it to work. This PS knife works fine, but the blade is SO SHORT! I make bread at home and use the electric knife to slice it. It just barely makes it across the knife without me having to make too passes. Really poor design and I'm so sad I didn't really look at the blade size before I bought. Very odd for this blade to be so short!
customer_reviews.author: jenni

customer_reviews.title: But it doesn't cut bread worth a damn
customer_reviews.text: The blades will oscillate nicely when not cutting anything, but as this product starts to cut into the bread the oscillations decrease to just tiny vibration. This means it takes me 20 seconds just to cut 1 slice of bread. My old crappy bread knife is faster and better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to shape my motorcycle seat foam!
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm to shape the foam on my custom motorcycle seat. It got the general shape in place and then I used a sanding disc on my angle grinder to shape the foam into more detail and compound angles where the knife couldn't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Long

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to trim foam and that is exactly what it did. No complaints. We drew our lines and cut it out.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP MADE
customer_reviews.text: First it is hard to hold, Hard to maintain a grip on it. It strains to cut anything, It sounds like it is trying to cut a log when I was trying to slice hae with it, It started feeling really hot and smelling like electrical does when it overheats. I tried cutting cheese, no go at all. Wish I had not wasted my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: TXFW

customer_reviews.title: Cutting foam.
customer_reviews.text: Was bought for food, used to cut upholstery foam. It did good with that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Cuts good, only reason I gave it a 4 is because after using for a bit roughly about 10 minutes or less it gets pretty warm in your hand. So kinda wondering how hot will it get if using on a long term.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my Dad who likes to make fresh bread. He loves it. It makes slicing the bread sooo easy.
customer_reviews.author: mojo821

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your time and money buying this.
customer_reviews.text: The blade was too short and the knife had no power. It could not cut through beef or crusty bread. Amazon prime was very good about returning my money.
customer_reviews.author: one hundred quilt mama

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a couple of weeks and it stopped working. Won’t turn on or anything. Mentions a 1 year guarantee but there are no instructions on how to exchange or return if the product malfunctions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: This knife was a wonderful price; however, it only worked for a very short time. After using it twice, it stopped entirely. I would guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: I use this to cut foam padding. It worked ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to cut foam padding. It worked well though it seems to not cut as well as the 30 year old one I had from my mom that died.
customer_reviews.author: SemperFI

customer_reviews.title: Only used 0nce so far
customer_reviews.text: This looked just like one I had many years ago. Was disappointed it was much smaller and the blades were shorter. How ever it was light weight and easy to hold when using which I liked that but it did seem to have less power than my old one. I tried to cut frozen liver with it, that was a bad idea. HA HA. I have not used it on fresh baked bread yet. It should work just fine for bread as long as the blades are long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Another Amazon dud (at least for me)
customer_reviews.text: Worse than using a manual knife! 1) Heavy, 2) vibrates too much during cutting process, 3) Cuts much slower, 4) Have to hold what you're cutting right at the edge of the counter-stop.
customer_reviews.author: Chris JungTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I bought it to cut frozen foods.  NO HELP
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to save money by buying large rolls of sausage and freezing them and using this knife for cutting. At this point that is the only thing I've tried and it was very disappointing. Hopefully I'll find some use for it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Classic, Basic Electric Knife That Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: This was the same electric knife I had growing up so it’s a classic and basic electric knife. It’s easy to hold and easy to use. It does the job when a manual knife is not enough.
customer_reviews.author: Boba Connoisseur

customer_reviews.title: cuts foam
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cut thick memory foam. Works well. Now I will keep it for future use. Guess it would cut meat or bread too but we really don't need it for that.
customer_reviews.author: Rita S. Reames

customer_reviews.title: Quality carving knife
customer_reviews.text: Quiet and smooth, strong. I used it for a totally off-label use, which was cutting upholstery foam, LOL. But it is easy to clean, so will be my turkey carver next year too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to handle
customer_reviews.text: It's very difficult to hold and operate the trigger if your hands are greasy or wet. This one will be used for cutting foam rubber and Styrofoam......with nice clean hands.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife but customer service is not good
customer_reviews.text: I bought my knife to cut bread. Knife broke. E-mailed customer service. OK, send us the model# and serial #. Did that. Now send us pictures of the knife. Did that. Pictures not good enough. Let me ship you the knife at my expense. No answer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S Keller

customer_reviews.title: Silex Electric Knife is awesome. I believe it's being under rated
customer_reviews.text: This Procter.Silex Electric Knife is awesome. I believe it's being under rated. I bought it to cut foam and it's powerful. Cuts through foam nice and easy. Very sharp blade. Nice. I like it. I'm writing from Grenada West Indies. Amazon . Thanks great service. Think I should give it 5 star rating. But it don't have any more stars available.
customer_reviews.author: 7Thunders

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This item worked very well and was just what we needed. The only thing is that We thought it had longer blades, but this still did not take away from the quality or the use we had for it. It was a real good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jer-Bear

customer_reviews.title: Blades are very sharp
customer_reviews.text: A bit shorter than my last one, but makes slicing the Turkey or Ham. A lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: James Scally

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 4 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: This product broke within minutes of using. Not satisfied at all. Will be returning, don't waste your time or money. I would opt for a higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: important kitchen item
customer_reviews.text: I will say it's a bit on the long side but very manageable. I used it for cutting corn off the cob for freezing and carving the Thanksgiving turkey.
customer_reviews.author: Din

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for foam and memory foam!
customer_reviews.text: Cut through 12" foam like butter. Straight and true. You do have let it do the cutting. If you force it, your cut will be jagged and you might burn it up.
customer_reviews.author: Happyhikes

customer_reviews.title: Cut foam like butter.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cut a giant piece of foam I needed for a couch. It cut through it with so much ease I was so happy with the results. 100% would use again
customer_reviews.author: hepua

customer_reviews.title: A bit cumbersome, but good none the less.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of experience with these so, all I can say is it works really well for crafting (I use it for craft work, not cooking) my only issue is that it is a bit cumbersome to move around, and it can heat up with long use. Otherwise happy to have though.
customer_reviews.author: Cyan

customer_reviews.title: Electric knife for fileting fish
customer_reviews.text: The electric knife arrived in the prescribed time. I have used it to filet white perch and catfish and it works better than the electric knife I bought in a sports store...and is less expensive also. This will be my choice of fileting fish from now on.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Sweet corn freezing
customer_reviews.text: Worked great cutting sweet corn, but like all electric knives, it makes your handle tingle and go numb after a long use. It also gets pretty warm after a long use, so I gave it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Johnson

customer_reviews.title: perfect for fooam cutting
customer_reviews.text: used to cut foam pad for my rv couch replacement it cut the foam like a hot knife through butter perfect smooth cuts no ragged edges
customer_reviews.author: walter bennett

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible knife. Hard to grip. Didn't work well at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: This does a decent job of cutting bread loaves, but I do find that I have to press rather firmly to get it to cut through. I wish the blades were a bit sharper but it works!
customer_reviews.author: Kim H

customer_reviews.title: You MAY end up sharpening blades when using on upholstery foam
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I used on upholstery foam. BUT, blades got full after 2 cushions! Sharpened with power saw file. Could NOT find oem replacement blades on Inet.
customer_reviews.author: victor

customer_reviews.title: Carve faster
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. I've always wanted an electric knife. I really didn't realize how much easier it really makes carving large chunks of meat like a ham.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Used to carve cushion. Would have given 5 stars ...
customer_reviews.text: Used to carve cushion. Would have given 5 stars if the rpm was higher or blades were sharper. Only got one use out of the blades on the bottom seat of a golf foam and it was done cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M.

customer_reviews.title: Wish the knife was longer
customer_reviews.text: I used it to cut a memory foam in half. Electric knife had a heavy handle. It did the job but it got hot fast. Had to give it a break.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie

customer_reviews.title: Struggles with bread crusts
customer_reviews.text: I buy electric knives for cutting home-made bread. The blades could be longer -- they just barely make it through the width of a loaf. Today, I sliced a store-bought "artisan" loaf, which had a delicious, chewy-hard crust, and the blades didn't want to cut through the bottom crust.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Keating

customer_reviews.title: Great electric knife at a low price
customer_reviews.text: Great electric knife at a low price. I gave three of these away recently as gifts to family members. They were all delighted and amazed at how much easier it was to cut bread loaves and meat dishes at family dinners.
customer_reviews.author: saychoss

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding and well made!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one in over 20 years...when I saw it, the hunt was over! I kept the blades from the first one...and yes, they fit! BTW...the price is “right”, as well!
customer_reviews.author: Little George

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy!! Try it... I approve!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the way this just cuts right through anything and it doesn't squish it. I bought it because I make a lot of homemade breads and I didn't like then always squished with a regular bread knife. Great buy!!! Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: Ajs mama

customer_reviews.title: Good For Upholstery Foam
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a few upholstery/cushion projects. I used it to cut the memory foam – it was like cutting thru warm butter. It made it easy to cut straight & clean.
customer_reviews.author: Katawampas

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Item as described I want to use this to cut thru foam for a tufted headboard project
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: did not work the way I thought would work...
customer_reviews.text: Does not cut the way is supposed to cut. I bought it to cut fish and other meat and can not cut through the bone at all. Disappointed in the electric knife.
customer_reviews.author: Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: It is an electric knife! I've used it to cut up meat, bread, and foam for a project. Works really well. Pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Funny Nacho

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I tried to contact the company and they don't answer their phone or emails. Don't waste your money on this!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Thanksgiving
customer_reviews.text: have always tried to carve my turkey with a regular knife and it never looks cute but with this knife it was easy and my platter of turkey looked great.
customer_reviews.author: Tt

customer_reviews.title: Basic knife, basic issues.
customer_reviews.text: It's good for a very basic knife. The motor isn't very powerful and it does run hot. Expect to do some vegetable oil lubricating of the blades between uses.
customer_reviews.author: Calico Dan

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: What can I say it works for what we use for. Our other lasted 15+ years and was just like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a knife through butte...... er.......plastic foam!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to cut foam for a travel case. Worked more easily than I expected. Very happy with the knife and the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney L Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used it to cut high density foam for chair cushions. I worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jad

customer_reviews.title: Prefer Cuisinart over this model
customer_reviews.text: It seems that the larger teeth on this knife. (larger than the last one we had) cut ok but whether real or perceived the meat wasn’t as tender as we expected. The blade on this one has larger teeth and was shorter too. Have since purchased a Cuisinart electric knife and like it much better, fine teeth, longer blade.
customer_reviews.author: Aurita L. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Electric knife
customer_reviews.text: Prior to this purchase, we were using an electric knife in its last days(30 years) the new model has is just perfect and so improved!!
customer_reviews.author: JACKIE

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: Blade length is 6.5 inches. It works Ok but would be better if the blades were longer. The Hamilton Beach model looks identical but the blades are 7.5 inches and the "trigger" has rubber on it making it easier to keep it on while cutting. I bought both...but kept the Hamilton Beach model and gave this one as a gift. I would say these knives are not the best but they do the job for $20. I've only used it to cut turkey and ham. Cuts meat fine but don't expect to be cutting through joints.
customer_reviews.author: jsmith6541

product_meta.title: Proctor Silex Easy Slice Electric Knife for Carving Meats, Poultry, Bread, Crafting Foam and More, Lightweight with Contoured Grip, White
product_meta.description: Proctor Silex Electric knife is a lightweight, easy-to-grip kitchen tool that effortlessly slices through meat, bread, and other foods like a Pro. It's even great for cutting foam for crafting and DIY projects. With reciprocating stainless steel blades to help you slice quickly and evenly, This versatile appliance has a hand-contoured grip for control and precision, making it perfect for everyday use or slicing large quantities for entertaining. The handle is comfortable for both right- and left-handed people. Proctor Silex electric knives are affordable and durable for consistently smooth slicing with every use. Designed for convenience and ease of use and to North American Electrical standards, these handy knives are essential, time-saving accessories for your busy kitchen.
feature_bullets: Perfect for Meats, great for breads: electric knife easily carves through everything from ham, turkey, bread, and tomatoes to crafting foam for DIY projects.
Stainless steel blades: This electric knife features reciprocating, serrated blades, giving you the control and precision to quickly create even slices.
Ergonomic Handle: electric carving knife fits comfortably in either hand and gives you accurate control and precision.
Easy touch-button control: simple trigger lets you safely activate your electric carving knife.
Lightweight: lightweight design makes it easy to hold electric knife when carving large quantities.
Great crafting knife: can be used as a foam cutter that cuts and slices crafting foam with ease.
